you-sent: Here is the information you have sent us

caseworker.heading: BRP reported as lost or stolen

lost-stolen.header: Your biometric residence permit or card has been cancelled
lost-stolen.paragraph-two: You have told us that your biometric residence permit (BRP) or biometric residence card (BRC) has been lost or stolen.
lost-stolen.paragraph-three: We have now cancelled your BRP or BRC. It cannot be used again if you find it later.
lost-stolen.header-two: If you want to travel to the UK
lost-stolen.paragraph-four: Physical documents like BRPs and BRCs are being replaced with an eVisa. An eVisa is an online record of your immigration status.
lost-stolen.paragraph-five: If you have an eVisa, you will also have been asked to create a UKVI account to access it. Your eVisa is linked to the information held in your UKVI account.
lost-stolen.paragraph-six: To travel on an eVisa your UKVI account must be up to date with:

paragraph-six-bullets.two: any new passport or travel documents

lost-stolen.header-three: If you are outside the UK  and you do not have eVisa or are unable to travel with one
lost-stolen.paragraph-seven: You will need to apply for a ‘Replacement BRP visa’. This visa will allow you to re-enter the UK only once. It costs £154.
lost-stolen.paragraph-eight: You will need to apply for another ‘Replacement BRP visa’ if you leave the UK again.
lost-stolen.header-four: If you have pre-settled or settled status under the EU Settlement Scheme
lost-stolen.paragraph-nine: If you have pre-settled or settled status under the EU Settlement Scheme, you will be able to use your eVisa (online immigration status) to travel to and from the UK. You do not need a BRC.
lost-stolen.paragraph-ten: You must make sure your current travel document is linked to your UKVI account.
lost-stolen.paragraph-eleven: If you are not able to update your UKVI account while you’re outside the UK, you should get an EU Settlement Scheme travel permit.
lost-stolen.header-five: When you return to the UK
lost-stolen.paragraph-twelve: If you do not already have an eVisa, you will need to set up access to your eVisa on the GOV.UK website.
lost-stolen.paragraph-thirteen: If you do not already have a UK Visas and Immigration (UKVI) account, you will be asked to

paragraph-thirteen-bullets.two: confirm your identity using the ‘UK Immigration ID Check’ app

lost-stolen.paragraph-fourteen: Your eVisa will be linked to your travel documents in your UKVI account.
lost-stolen.paragraph-fifteen: You must keep your passport or ID card details up to date in your UKVI account and tell us about any changes. This is so that your immigration status can be easily identified at the UK border. You’ll still need to carry your current passport with you.
lost-stolen.paragraph-sixteen: You will not need a BRP or BRC to leave the UK, you will be able to travel on your eVisa.
lost-stolen.header-six: If you find your biometric residence permit or card
lost-stolen.paragraph-seventeen: If you find your BRP or BRC, you must return it by post when you return to the UK to:
lost-stolen.header-seven: If you need further help or advice
lost-stolen.paragraph-eighteen: Contact your local Visa Application Centre for help.
lost-stolen.paragraph-nineteen: Do not reply to this email for help regarding your replacement BRP visa.
lost-stolen.fake-email: If you receive an email about UK Visas and Immigration and are unsure of its authenticity, do not reply to it or click on any of the links.

lost-stolen-uk.header-one: If you want to travel outside of the UK
lost-stolen-uk.paragraph-one: You can no longer ask for a replacement BRP or BRC.
lost-stolen-uk.paragraph-two: You can set up access to your eVisa on the GOV.UK website.
lost-stolen-uk.paragraph-three: If you do not already have a UK Visas and Immigration (UKVI) account, you will be asked to:

paragraph-three-bullets.two: confirm your identity using the ‘UK Immigration ID Check’ app

lost-stolen-uk.paragraph-four: Your eVisa is linked to the information in your UKVI account.
lost-stolen-uk.paragraph-five: If you have pre-settled or settled status under the EU Settlement Scheme, you will be able to use your eVisa (online immigration status) to travel to and from the UK.
lost-stolen-uk.paragraph-six: If you find your BRP or BRC, you must return it by post to:
lost-stolen-uk.paragraph-seven: Contact UK Visas and Immigration for help.
